results.title: Fires within
results.creator_credit: Pathe Entertainment, Wallis Nicita, Lauren Lloyd and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: When husband and wife Nestor (Jimmy Smits) and Isabel (Greta Scacchi) are reunited after Nestor is freed from jail for serving a 10 year term as a political prisoner they both find it hard to existence as husband and wife, living in Miami’s Little Havana. The community are eager for Nestor to resume his role as spokesperson for atrocities perpetrated by the Cuban government. His wife, Isabel (Greta Scacchi), does not want their lives or their families in Cuba sacrificed to the greater cause of freedom of expression. Isabel has also found love in the arms of the American fisherman who saved her and her daughter when they nearly drowned fleeing Cuba, and like her husband, she too must make a choice between her priorities as a lover, and as a wife and mother. Cast also includes Vincent D’Onofrio.

results.title: Fires were started
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit, Ian Dalrymple and Humphrey Jennings
results.brief_description: A main contribution of Britain to the development of cinematography has been the creation of a distinctive school of film-making - the documentary film. Using non-professional actors “FIRES WERE STARTED” is the first feature film by Humphrey Jennings and is one of the most moving of the war documentaries, recapturing the typical atmosphere of the war on Britain’s civilian front. The film is a tribute to the work of the Auxiliary Fire Service, described through the events of one-day activities. The story unfolds without effort from the early morning assembly of crew at the fire station, through the routine of the day, to the fighting of a blazing warehouse at night.

results.title: Fires of the mind: workings of the human brain
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Outlines findings of current research into the workings of the human brain - its anatomy and physiology, discoveries concerning its evolution and research into such areas as memory, the sense of self, and the human mind’s ability to reflect upon itself.

results.title: Fireman Sam. Treasure hunt
results.brief_description: Four more adventures with Sam and his friends in the little Welsh village of Pontypandy. “Treasure Hunt”: Sarah and James find more than buried treasure in the village park! “Sam’s Day Off”: Sam becomes an inventor in his spare time but his pop-corn machine has a few teething problems. “Thief in Pontypandy”: things go missing all over the village. Can Sam solve the mystery? “Chemistry set”: Norman’s experiments in chemistry backfire.

results.title: Fireman Sam. Spot of bother
results.brief_description: There’s never a dull moment for Fireman Sam and his friends in four more delightful stories. “Dilys’ Forgetful Day”: Dilys loses her memory; and firefighter Penny Morris is introduced to Pontypandy’s Fire Service. “Halloween”: It’s Halloween in Pontypandy, with tricks and treats for everybody. “Spot of Bother”: Norman fakes chicken pox to avoid a spelling test. “Norman’s Pitfall”: Norman falls down an old coal mine shaft - just as well there’s more than one way out!

results.title: Fireman Sam. Snow business
results.brief_description: It’s Christmas Eve in Pontypandy but it’s no holiday for the Fire Service! A fresh fall of snow means that Fireman Sam has a busy day. Trevor’s bus runs foul of a snow drift, and the children’s toboggan ride nearly ends in disaster … just as well Sam is always on hand to help his friends, and make sure that everyone has a happy and peaceful Christmas. Told by John Alderton.

results.title: Fireman Sam
results.creator_credit: Bumper Film, Ian Frampton and John Walker
results.brief_description: Four stories featuring Fireman Sam and his friends in the town of Pontypandy narrated by John Alderton. The first story shows what happens when a trick is played on the fireman as a sticky substance is smeared on the fireman pole. There is a cat stuck up a tree in the second episode, a camping trip in the third and a special appearance on television by the Station Officer which excites the locals.

results.title: Firemaking and shelters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Outdoor Education and Recreation”.
An experienced woodsman and a group are stranded in the wilderness. Led by the woodsman, they locate a good campsite, build a shelter of poles and evergreen boughs, construct a fire reflector and build a fire. The woodsman then demonstrates how a fire can be built even without matches, using the Indian bow and drill method.

results.title: Fireline
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production, Norman Laird and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Shows methods and uses of making a fireline - a line made or used to stop the spread of a bushfire. The fire is contained with a strip either man-made or mechanically made. Defines fire-edge and fire-head, and then demonstrates two techniques of fire fighting: parallel attack and direct attack. Suggests methods of controlling fire crews and recommends safe clothing.

results.title: Firelight = Clair-Obscure
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and Paul Bochner
results.brief_description: A highly personal and impressionistic piece of work, Firelight explores time. This animated film has long dissolves and pastel shades which reflect its ephemeral nature, its steady progression and the constancy of its cycles. It is a gentle film that sets the mind adrift. Film without words. Music by Eldon Rathburn.
